title: Incredible moment a SEAL leaps out of the water to devour a bird in Melbourne's filthy Yarra River
text:
A cheeky seal has been caught hunting seagulls flying too close to the surface of Melbourne's Yarra River.

Incredible footage captured the moment the seal launched out of the water and devoured a seagull, thrashing in the water as it tried to kill the bird.

The Yarra River is notoriously known for being polluted, with nearly 180 tonnes of rubbish being collected from the area over a four-year period.

A group of seagulls are filmed circling above a spot on the Yarra River in Melbourne, presumably hunting for fish to eat

Footage of the brutal moment was uploaded to Facebook, where people were quick to question whether the water was safe for the seal to swim in.

'Would it be stupid to ask if it's healthy for them to be in the Yarra? How unsanitary is the Yarra these days?,' questioned one person.

'My partner used to work on the Yarra. He saw a few seals that had travelled upstream and they all had eye damage/were blind and had to be put down,' another answered.

'I'm really hoping the Yarra is cleaner now and life is good for this guy.'

Another wrote: 'Poor thing. Not gonna survive unless it gets a little crazy.'

As one seagull flies close to the water's surface, a large seal launches out of the water and gobbles the bird up

The seal thrashes around in the water as it eats the seagull while its feathered friends quickly fly away

Some people claimed the seal was Salvatore, a 200kg-plus fur seal who made the Yarra River his home in 2017.

He was initially discovered in 2014 after he was seen eating a massive fish in South Yarra.

Melbourne's Zoo's Marine Response Unit was called a few months later after they found him wasting away under a pier.

He had box tape wrapped around his neck, which had cut deep into his skin, and had to be sedated with a dart gun.

The box tape was successfully removed from his neck, which left distinctive scars, and he was administered antibiotics and pain relief before being released.
description: A cheeky seal has been caught hunting seagulls flying too close to the surface of Melbourne's Yarra River.
authors: Thomas Duff For Daily Mail Australia
